utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: How are you doing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh, not too great I've had this cough the last few days.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, umm, how old are you?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so for the past couple of days you said, so is that two days? Three days?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I think 3 three days.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and is it a dry cough or are you bringing up anything?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's dry.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so no sputum, no blood?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No blood.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and do you feel wheezy at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no wheezing.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No  shortness of breath?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Now I ran to catch the bus yesterday and I was a bit more short of breath than I would usually be.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you had a fever?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I've felt hot yes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, did you actually take your temperature or do you just feel hot?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I just got hot.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK so we can take your temperature today. Any chest pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No chest pain.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and any throat pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, my throat's been a little sore, but I thought it was maybe just because I was coughing so much.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and any issues swallowing food?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Umm, no problems swallowing food.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any changes in your smell?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Now that you mention it, yeah I thought it was maybe just plugged up, but I haven't really been able to smell these last few days.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and how about hearing? Any changes in your hearing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No changes there.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK any ear pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No ear pain, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any changes in your vision?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Umm, I got glasses last year but nothing recently.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and any eye pain or discharge from the eyes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you had any night sweats or chills?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any weight loss?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No weight loss, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and then how about changes in your bowel movements?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, everything's been regular there.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, no diarrhea, no constipation, no blood in your stool?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No diarrhea, no constipation, and I haven't noticed any blood.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any changes in your urine?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK. Um, how about muscle aches or pains?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I felt pretty, uh, well, yeah, I guess achy and weak.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Did that start around the same time that you experienced your cough and possible fever?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: :Yeah, I would say it started around the same time.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any dizziness?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any confusion or memory loss?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any fainting spells?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any rashes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I haven't noticed any rashes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so it's your cough and just in general how you feel. Does it get better or worse with anything? Have you tried you know Tylenol and any antipyretics?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I tried some uh like day and night time Tylenol at home to sleep but still, when I woke up in the morning, still not feeling very good and the cough is still here too.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, yeah. Have you ever experienced anything like this before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Maybe as a kid. I mean, I remember getting the flu. I had a cough and that sort of thing, but I haven't been sick for several years now.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Umm, and then since you started having this cough too, now has anything changed? How are you feeling worse? Or do you feel kind of the same as when it started?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I would say I feel a bit worse.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and has anyone around you been sick recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Umm, no, not that I know of. Yeah, everybody in the house has been OK.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you traveled anywhere recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Umm, yeah, I was visiting some cousins up North several weeks ago, but that was just traveling within the province.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and they're fine? No one is sick?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I haven't heard of anybody being sick.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and are you otherwise healthy? Do you have any medical conditions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I've been told I had high cholesterol before. But I don't take any medications for it. I've been just trying to lose some weight and exercise more.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Sure, OK. No surgeries or hospitalizations in the past?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and no other medications?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Umm, no,  I just take a multivitamin.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Ok, and no other you know over the counter medications or herbal stuff?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I'll use my Tylenol or Ibuprofen or Advil I guess if I get the occasional headache.  And I guess, umm, something like Reactine or Claritin for the seasonal allergies but that's about it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And so you said seasonal allergies. Any other allergies?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Umm, no, just usually like in the springtime.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and are you up to date with all your immunizations?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah I am. Yeah I get the flu shot every year.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK good. And in terms of family history, do any of your family members have lung conditions or heart conditions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I know mom has high blood pressure, but nobody's had a heart attack or, uh, no lung conditions either.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any cancers that run in the family?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Umm, none, I can't think of any.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and then do you smoke?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I just I smoke cannabis every once in awhile.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how much do you smoke?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, I would say maybe, I enjoy it on the weekends.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Did you say a joint on the weekends?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so is that like 1 milligram?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I would say something about that. Yeah, it's not much.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. But no cigarettes though?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any other recreational drugs?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and do you drink alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Umm, I do, yeah, I'll have like two or three beers on the weekend.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Sure. And and where do you live?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I'm just like 20 minutes down the road in a house here.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Sure, is it an apartment complex or is it like a full house?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, it's a single family home. I live there with my wife and three kids.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um any concerns with your living arrangements you know, like old carpets or anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Actually last year we had most of the carpets taken out, so not anymore.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK good good. Did you have any other questions or concerns? Anything that you wanted to bring up that I didn't touch on today?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I was just really worried that this could be COVID. I mean I have a cough and just have been feeling really hot so I was just concerned about that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, for sure, and I think that's a valid concern. So right now I'm just going through, you know, a list of differential diagnoses that you could possibly have and COVID, it's definitely top on my list and so we will likely get a swab and run those tests and try to get that back to you as soon as we can. It could also be other respiratory infections, especially viral infections this time of the year. And so, if it comes back negative for COVID, it's probably you know something else like respiratory virus or even the flu. So we'll go from there. And if it turns out it's not a viral infection, we will likely see if it's some sort of bacterial infection in which we can prescribe antibiotics for those. But it definitely sounds like there's an infectious picture going on here because of the acuteness of the presentation, and just your symptoms. So we will do afollow up in a week or so. Until then, we will run all these labs. Does that sound good?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Alright, yeah, that sounds good, so I guess I will kind of self isolate until the COVID results come back.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Oh yes please do so. That's that's a great point. I do suggest isolating for two weeks at least if you have any sort of symptoms, because even though the PCR that we do to test for COVID is supposed to be reliable and it's supposed to be specific and sensitive, there are sometimes false negative tests. You know, just to be on the safe side, if you're experiencing any of the symptoms that overlap with COVID symptoms, isolate for two weeks. But by the end of the week we should know what the test results are and then you will know for sure what you have.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: OK, awesome, thank you.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
